data.title: Good food
data.text:
Carolina ale is a friendly place where the people are nice and the food is good service is important and the staff knows when to come by and when to leave U alone

I was there for a business meeting and the atmosphere was great

Highly recommend this establishment

data.title: Friendly Staff, Nice Atmosphere, Good Food
data.text: Attended a car show with a friend. Restaurant was very busy but waitress appeared quickly.  Placed beverage order which arrived quickly but waitress was quick to leave without getting a question we had, seemed rushed. Came back and took the food order,  but the item initially delivered, soup,  was the wrong item, with the correct item arriving shortly thereafter. Main course arrived in a timely matter. Refill of beverages was hap hazard, as only one of us got a refill at each time...Overall the food was very good, service was friendly but rushed...they seemed to be short staffed as after we ate, we joined some friends dining outside and the same was true with the service.

data.title: Four visited and 2 liked it and 2 did not.
data.text: I give it 21/2 .the 2 that ordered hamburgers liked it the 2 that ordered a sandwich and a wrap did not enjoy the food,.

data.title: Good food and entertainment
data.text: We had never been here before, so we were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was.  Their fries are fantastic.  Crisp on the outside, soft and tender inside.  The food was plentiful and very good.  They had outdoor seating as well as bar seating, besides the usual inside area.  Trivia competition was going on in one area, but the questions could be heard throughout the restaurant, making for an enjoyable wait to get your dinner.  I would recommend this place.  Plenty of selections on the menu and happy hour until 7 pm.

data.title: Accommodations Plus
data.text: Being on a special diet, I can be extra work for a staff. The crew at the Carolins Ale House went above and beyond to customize my meal that first time I visited last Jan, 2016, it became our favorite spot in the area, ate there at least twice a week all last season.. Looking forward to heading that way again this coming winter and visiting my favorite restaurant

data.title: Noisy Family Place
data.text: An average sports bar type of place. Service was pretty slow (we had a new waitress). Food quality was average, I had a chicken ceasar salad, the chicken was cold and tasteless. The rest of the orders were pretty good. The place was pretty crowded and noisy, we sat in an area that was close to the smoking area, so every time they opened the door, we got a blast of smoke. Plenty of TVs on the walls, had some arcade games for the kiddies. Good for families.

data.title: Bar Chow in a Happy Environment
data.text: The food at the Carolina Ale House is good and the portions are ample but not especially distinguished.  However, if you're looking for a great sports bar (with the typical food and drink for such a venue), this is it.  The restaurant is decked out in all the paraphernalia and signage you can imagine for the major Florida universities--Florida State, Florida, and Miami--plus many other amateur and professional sports teams.  This is a great place to congregate with your buddies during football season.  There are no seats in the house which don't have a good view of a large flat screen.  Round up your crew and head to the CAH.

data.title: Carolina Ale House
data.text:
Carolina Ale House has such a nice place, close to the mall and bus routes for us as South Africans with only public transport this was a great location...

A few visits later after just some drinks at the bar we had the best Burgers ever nice thing is can sit right at the bar having lunch and a beer well nothing beats a good old pub lunch... 

staff was always so friendly with a good conversation looming every time we went to the establishment, so sad to be back home but next time we in the States this is one of my first stops!!

data.title: Great family atmosphere
data.text: We went to Ale House to have dinner with party of 15. Great food and great atmosphere. TVs everywhere and no wait. Good burgers and fries and affordable

data.title: Great place for gathering
data.text:
I had a party of 30 people. Ryan (mgr on duty) had reserved the center area with High-Top tables for us so we could mingle with each other and not be stuck in seats. 
This made it a great evening to see our friends and family we've missed since moving away 2 yrs ago. 

The service was excellent, especially for such a large group with separate tabs!  
My "Pub Burger" was delicious!!
Food was served hot and pretty quick!

data.title: Good Food, Good Service & Fun
data.text:
We were seated immediately because we accepted a table instead of waiting for a booth.  Our server was great and knew the menu well enough to make knowledgable recommendations.  She was attentive, yet not intrusive. Cocktails are full pour.  We ordered wings and a grilled chicken sandwich.  The wings are great.  They are available baked of grilled.  Opted for grilled.  When they arrived, we were amazed at the size of the wings.  If we knew their size, we would have ordered a half dozen rather than a dozen.  But we took some home and they were as good re-warmed at home as they were on premises.  The chicken sandwich we ordered was like a patty melt only with grilled chicken breast and along with onions and cheese, they add mushrooms.  It was great!
A very pleasant casual dining experience.  Huge bar and TV's everywhere.  Would we return?  Absolutely!

data.title: Great Late Night Place
data.text: Stopped here real late and was glad to find they were still serving.  Staff was very friendly and so was server. Food was very good.

data.title: Sometimes you want to go... where they're always glad you came.
data.text:
Being a tourist going to touristy places packed with lots of other tourists sometimes becomes tiresome. And, as the Cheers theme song puts it, "Sometimes you want to go where everybody knows your name, and they're always glad you came."  If you are travelling in the Boynton Beach area, that place could be the Carolina Ale House. Located in the Boynton Commons Mall, this definitely is a locals' sports bar and restaurant, but if you go more than once, the bar maids (especially Brittany), the manager and the regulars soon will know your name and be really glad you came.

At each front end of the bar are machines with several video games that keep score and a tally of the leading players. The competition is fierce but fun and players are anxious to know who the competition is. All around the bar and restaurant 50+ monitors constantly track all the major sports programming on TV and rooting for or cheering against the pro and college teams always leads to friendly rivalries and much discussion.

The drinks are well poured, the beer and ale list is endless and the food is typical pub fare. Burgers, pizzas, tacos and salads are the best bet, and during late afternoon and early evening happy hours there are many appetizers, like Buffalo popcorn shrimp, sweet potato fries, ahi wontons, fried pimiento cheese balls and shrimp tempura  available for as little as $3.95 and $4.95.

With its good drinks, cheap eats and a friendly, fun atmosphere, Carolina Ale House is a perfect escape from the tourist traps.

data.title: Totally Mediocre
data.text: We ended up in the Carolina Ale House tonight, for the same reason we always go there: it was high season, everyplace else was jammed, and it was the only place we could get into. If you're not busy in those circumstances, there's a reason for it. The reasons in this case: food is okay (not great, but not terrible either), but service and attitude are horrendous. No one greets you or smiles when you come in or thanks you when you leave. Servers are perfunctory (you never see the same people twice). No one checks to see how you're doing, no one clears the table off, no one cares.

data.title: great sports bar with good food
data.text: I had dinner here with my parents.  My mother is gluten free and they offer a gluten free menu.  she ordered GF pizza . it was tasty. when we asked the waitress if it was made there she said the pizza shell is frozen GF but they add the sauce and toppings.  My mother enjoyed it and she is picky.  I had chicken sandwich on brioche roll. it was okay.  my father had the salmon and he loved it.  the menu does say it is wild salmon and not farm raised.  I would recommend this place if you are in the mood for this type of restaurant. there is lots of seating, booths high tops, outdoor and bar seating.

data.title: Average Bar food place
data.text: Went here for a quick lunch the service was very good the booths comfortable even for a big guy. the food was good but I consider it average for this type of restaurant.

data.title: Worth a try...
data.text: Went there for dinner. The Cheese curds, not found at other "Ale Houses", were great. My Fish with the fries was also great. My companions were very pleased with their burgers. Beer choices were also good. I feel,(subjective), that this is a step above the other Ale Houses in the area.

data.title: good supper
data.text:
Just returned from eating at the Carolina Ale House with long time friends.  Service was pretty good.  The food was quite good.  The prices were fair. 
The parking lot seemed full, but the restaurant seemed empty.  I have looked at reviews on other sites and think the reviews were   not indicative of our experience.  This is not a gourmet destination, but a good place at a fair price.

data.title: not overly impressed
data.text: they had a car show and we decided to eat here.  it was just OK..  nothing special.  service slow.  portions just OK..  I wont be back..  to many other better choices.

data.title: Horrible service by a new waiter!
data.text:
They have a lot of turnover on help.Food is mediocre. Took our chicken sand. & sweet potato fries 45 min. as he gave it to another table. Had to ask for silverware & napkins.He kept repeating our requests back to us..for ex: U wanted lemons for your water?, etc.2 seconds later.
Had very young kids screaming in the next room and banging around.parents did nothing, management did nothing.In fact I never saw a manager walking around.
